The claim is supported by the expert: s statement that measles is one of the most common causes of child blindness worldwide.
The expert: s statement is further supported by the fact that conjunctivitis, or pink eye, is a common side effect of a measles infection.
While measles: related blindness is not common in North America and Europe due to high vaccination rates, it is a significant concern in low-income countries where access to vaccines and malnutrition are prevalent factors.
